comments.body: I have tried not having this piece of code.  int32 output convolution today will be flagged by BuffereComparator::CompareEqual, because S32 is not implemented.  Once BuffereComparator::CompareEqual supports S32, cudnn_conv_runner may be the next one checking against int32 output convolution.  If no sanity check flags it, CuDNN itself will error about it eventually.  However, I prefer raise error in this function, because it is designed to handle int32 output convolution for CuDNN and is able to give specific message.
I can merge in a change supporting S32 for BufferComparator.
Could you provide some more context? From the description, this PR adds support for int8 convolutions, why are we talking about int32?
